api.name: AddDemoBookmark
api.description: adds the information to the demo bookmarking system

parameters.name: birthTime
parameters.description: Birth Time

api.name: ArraySort
api.description: Returns a sorted array of entities by closest or farthest distance from <origin>

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: array to sort

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: the origin from which to compare

parameters.name: closest
parameters.description: if set to true the array will be sorted by distance closest to <origin>, if false by distance farthest from <origin>

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: if set then only the first <max> count of entities will be returned

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: if set then only the entities within <range> will be considered

api.name: ArraySortClosest
api.description: Returns a sorted array of entities by closest from <origin>

parameters.name: array
parameters.description: array to sort

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: the origin from which to compare

parameters.name: <maxReturnCount
parameters.description: if set then only the first <max> count of entities will be returned

parameters.name: minDist
parameters.description: if set then only the entities further than <minDist> will be considered

parameters.name: maxDist
parameters.description: if set then only the entities closer then <maxDist will be considered

api.name: BadPlace_Box
api.description: Creates a bad place box. AI will flee this position if they can, and will not go into it if they can avoid it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the bad place. If name is not "", the bad place can be moved or deleted by using the unique name.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: If duration > 0, the bad place will automatically delete itself after this time. If duration <= 0, the bad place must have a name and will last until manually deleted.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The origin of the box.

parameters.name: halfSize
parameters.description: The halfSize of the box.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: You must specify at least one team for which this place is bad, but can give several.  The allowed teams are 'axis', 'allies', and 'neutral'.

api.name: BadPlace_Cylinder
api.description: Creates a bad place cylinder. AI will flee this position if they can, and will not go into it if they can avoid it.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the bad place. If name is not "", the bad place can be moved or deleted by using the unique name.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: If duration > 0, the bad place will automatically delete itself after this time. If duration <= 0, the bad place must have a name and will last until manually deleted.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The origin of the cylinder.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius of the cylinder.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the cylinder.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: You must specify at least one team for which this place is bad, but can give several.  The allowed teams are 'axis', 'allies', and 'neutral'.

api.name: BadPlace_Delete
api.description: Deletes a bad place. It is okay to delete a bad place name that doesn't exist. It is not okay to delete the special name "".

parameters.name: bad place identifier
parameters.description: The bad place to delete

api.name: BeamTrace
api.description: Performs a bullet trace between two points and returns an array of information about the trace result.

parameters.name: start_pos
parameters.description: (point) The start position for the trace.

parameters.name: end_pos
parameters.description: (point) The end position for the trace.

parameters.name: hit_characters
parameters.description: (bool) Tell the trace to hit characters or not.

parameters.name: ignore_ent
parameters.description: (entity) Entity to ingore for trace.

parameters.name: ignore_water
parameters.description: (bool) Ignore water - defaults to false.

parameters.name: ignore_glass
parameters.description: (bool) Ignore glass - defaults to false.

parameters.name: ignore_ent2
parameters.description: (entity) Second entity to ingore for trace.

parameters.description: The direction of the bobbing

parameters.description: The amount of the bobbing in units

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The period of the bobbing in seconds

parameters.name: phase
parameters.description: The phase offset of the bobbing

api.name: BoundsWouldTelefrag
api.description: Returns true if the passed in bounding box would telefrag a player if another player was spawned there.

parameters.description: Mins of bounding box

parameters.name: maxs
parameters.description: Maxs of bounding box

api.example: if ( BoundsWouldTelefrag( vehicle GetAbsMins(), vehicle GetAbsmaxs() ) ) ...

api.name: BulletSpread

parameters.name: start

parameters.name: spread
parameters.description: Amount of spread

api.name: BulletTrace
api.description: Performs a bullet trace between two points and returns a map array of information about the trace result.

parameters.name: startPos
parameters.description: The starting position of the trace.

parameters.name: endPos
parameters.description: The ending position for the trace.

parameters.name: hitCharacters
parameters.description: Whether the trace should hit characters.

parameters.name: ignoreEnt
parameters.description: An entity that should be ignored by the trace, which can be `undefined`.

parameters.name: ignoreWater
parameters.description: Whether the trace should ignore water surfaces. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: ignoreGlass
parameters.description: Whether the trace should ignore glass surfaces. Defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: ignoreEnt2
parameters.description: If specified, a second entity that the trace should ignore.

returns.name: result
returns.description: A map of information about the bullet trace result.

api.example: a_trace = BulletTrace( org1, org2, true, undefined )

api.name: BulletTracePassed
api.description: Allows script to do a bullet point trace with ( MASK_SHOT & ~CONTENTS_SKY ) returns true if the trace does not hit anything

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The bullet start point

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The bullet end point

parameters.name: hit characters
parameters.description: An entity to ignore

parameters.name: ignore entity
parameters.description: An entity to ignore

parameters.name: ignore entity 2
parameters.description: An entity to ignore

parameters.name: fx vis
parameters.description: check against fx visibility also

parameters.name: ignore water
parameters.description: mask contents_water

api.example: passed = BulletTracePassed( grenade.origin, self.origin + (0,0,TROPHY_TRACE_Z), false, self )

api.name: DamageConeTrace
api.description: Determines how much the entity can be seen from the given position. Performs multiple traces and returns an approximation to how much of the entity is visible from the given point (between 0 and 1). In SinglePlayer this will always be 1 if the entity is partially visible.

parameters.name: damage position
parameters.description: The point the sight starts at

parameters.name: ignore entity
parameters.description: An entity to ignore when doing the traces

parameters.name: damage angles
parameters.description: The forward direction of the cone, whose base is at the <damage position>.  Must be normalized.

parameters.name: cone angle
parameters.description: Angle in degrees from the line of sight to the edge of the cone.  Defaults to 65.

calledOn.name: target

parameters.description: How detailed the cut part matches the entity. 0 or omitted: Box. 1: Convex hull fitting rough shape. 2: [SUPER EXPENSIVE] Use collision shape directly.

api.name: DoDamage
api.description: Deals damage to the given entity.

calledOn.name: target
calledOn.description: The entity that the damage should be dealt upon.

parameters.name: health
parameters.description: The amount of damage to do.

parameters.name: sourcePosition
parameters.description: The source location that the damage comes from.

parameters.name: attacker
parameters.description: The entity that dealt the damage (such as an AI or player).

parameters.name: inflictor
parameters.description: The entity that the damage came from (such as a grenade or turret).

parameters.name: hitLoc
parameters.description: The location of the damage, which defaults to `none`.

parameters.name: mod
parameters.description: The means of death string. If not specified, the means of death will be `MOD_UNKNOWN`.

parameters.name: dFlags
parameters.description: Any flags associated with the damage being dealt. Defaults to 0 (no flags).

parameters.name: weapon
parameters.description: The weapon used to deal the damage.

parameters.name: destructiblePieceIndex
parameters.description: The destructible piece index from the destructible def GDT.

parameters.name: forcePain
parameters.description: When set to `true`, the target entity's pain time is reset to zero, forcing them to produce a pain reaction to the damage.

api.example: player DoDamage(25, gasEffectArea.origin, player.lastPoisonedBy, grenade_obj, 0, "MOD_EXPLOSIVE", 0, GetWeapon("tabun_gas_mp"), -1, false)
remarks: For the `dFlags` parameter, each flag corresponds to a particular bit position, allowing them to be combined. These are defined in `shared.gsh`.

api.name: GeneratePointsAroundCenter
api.description: generate uniformly distributed points around a center in 2D (XY) plane

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Position to start the search around.

parameters.name: maxSearchRadius
parameters.description: the maximum radius away from origin.

parameters.name: innerSpacing
parameters.description: the distance between points at the minRadius.

parameters.name: minRadius
parameters.description: the minimum radius away from origin. should be between 0 and maxRadius (both inclusive).

parameters.name: outerSpacing
parameters.description: if defined, the distance between points will be Lerped from <innerSpacing> to [outerSpacing], to create a gradual distribution from minRadius to maxRadius.

parameters.name: distributionBias
parameters.description: (vec2) if defined, the density of the points will be changed gradually along the direction of this vector. the magnitude will be use as scalar, with 1 being the norm scale.

api.name: GetClosestPointOnNavMesh
api.description: Get a point on NavMesh that's closest to the given position within radius. Returns the adjusted position if found one, or undefined if not found. If distFromBoundary is defined, the point found on NavMesh will then be moved again to get it away from boundary

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position to start the search around.

parameters.name: searchRadius
parameters.description: Radius to search within. If not provided, a default value proximately equal to player size will be used.

parameters.name: distFromBoundary
parameters.description: Distance to keep away from NavMesh boundary. This distance can NOT be guaranteed. If not provided, it will be treated as 15 (AI default radius).

parameters.name: materialFlags
parameters.description: the flags marking whether a face type can be used

api.name: PlayerLinkTo
api.description: Attaches the player to an entity. Any entity rotation is added to the player's view, allow the player to look around. Rotating the parent entity/tag will not move the player's eye position, but only the player's view angles. Thus, the player's eye position is locked in place, always directly above the parent tag.

parameters.name: linkto entity
parameters.description: The entity to attach the player to.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag to attach the player to.

parameters.name: view fraction
parameters.description: How much the change in the tag's rotation effects the players view. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: right arc
parameters.description: Angle to clamp view to the right. Defaults to 180.

parameters.name: left arc
parameters.description: Angle to clamp view to the left. Defaults to 180.

parameters.name: top arc
parameters.description: Angle to clamp view to the top. Defaults to 180.

parameters.name: bottom arc
parameters.description: Angle to clamp view to the bottom. Defaults to 180.

parameters.name: use tag angles
parameters.description: Determines how the player's view will be tilted. 'False' (default) means that the orientation of the tag when the player is linked will appear flat to the player. Any rotation from that orientation will tilt the player's view. 'True' means that only a tag angles of (0,0,0) will appear flat to the player. Any rotation from (0,0,0) will tilt the player's view.

parameters.name: auto recenter
parameters.description: Players view will auto recenter to the tag he is linked to. use tag angles must be true.

api.name: PlayerLinkToAbsolute
api.description: Attaches the player to an entity. No view movement is allowed.  The player's eye position will remain fixed relative to the parent entity/tag. Thus, pitching and rolling will cause the player's eye position to move. (But the player entity always remains vertical)

parameters.name: lockto entity
parameters.description: The entity to attach the player to

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The tag to attach the player to

api.name: PlayerLinkToBlend

parameters.name: pos decel time
parameters.description: Decelaration time. Default is 0.

parameters.name: angle time
parameters.description: angle Lerp duration in seconds. Default is <time>.

parameters.name: angle accel time
parameters.description: angle Acceleration time. Default is 0.

parameters.name: angle decel time
parameters.description: angle Decelaration time. Default is 0.

(But the player entity always remains vertical)

Any rotation from that orientation will tilt the player's view. 'True' means that only a tag angles of (0,0,0) will appear flat to the player. Any rotation from (0,0,0) will tilt the player's view.

api.name: PositionQuery_Filter_Directness
api.description: Directness filter compute the direction information for each of the positions, relative to <origin> and <target>.

parameters.name: queryStruct

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: usually the position of AI before move.

api.name: PositionQuery_Filter_DistanceToGoal
api.description: Calculate the distance to <entity>.goalpos. If the point is in <entity>.goalradius, the distance will be 0. the result is in pointStruct.distToGoal

parameters.name: queryStruct
parameters.description: result from PositionQuery_Source function."

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: the entity used to check goal."

api.name: PositionQuery_Filter_InClaimedLocation
api.description: Check if the locations are inside other sentients claimed locations <entity>.inClaimedLocation.

api.name: PositionQuery_Filter_Sight
api.description: Sight filter do sight check on each of the positions to a target position, and store the result in pointStruct.visibility (boolean).

parameters.name: queryStruct
parameters.description: result from PositionQuery_Source function. each point contained here will be used to check sight against <targetPosition>. "

parameters.name: targetPosition
parameters.description: the position to check sight."

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset to add on each point before sight checking. this is usually something like: offset = ai GetEye() - ai.origin. default to (0,0,0). "

parameters.name: visibleBy_Ent
parameters.description: if defined, the corresponding sight check function on Actor or Vehicle will be called. Otherwise the checks just do simple bullet tracing."

parameters.name: numOfPassedToEarlyOut
parameters.description: if defined and bigger than 0, the filter will early out after found this many passed sight checks. this is useful if the points are pre sorted by score and we don't care about lower scored ones."

parameters.name: ignoreEnt
parameters.description: ignore entity during trace. if [visibleBy_Ent] is defined, it is already ignored internally. "

parameters.name: resultVarName
parameters.description: by default the results will be stored in pointStruct.visibility, but can be override by this string. "

api.example: PositionQuery_Filter_Sight( queryResult, self.enemy.origin, self GetEye() - self.origin, self, 30, self.enemy );

api.name: PositionQuery_Source_Navigation
api.description: Generate points around <origin>, between <minSearchRadius> and <maxSearchRadius> and within <halfHeight> height difference. For ground AI, the points will be on Nav Mesh; for flying AI, the points will be in Nav Volume. Only the points in pathable area will be kept. If the <origin> itself is in pathable area, all the points are guaranteed to be reachable from <origin>. If the <origin> is outside pathable area, all the points will still be in pathable areas surrounding <origin>, but reach-abilities cannot be guaranteed.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Position to start the search around.

parameters.name: minSearchRadius
parameters.description: the minimum radius away from origin.

parameters.name: maxSearchRadius
parameters.description: the maximum radius away from origin. can equal to minSearchRadius.

parameters.name: halfHeight
parameters.description: the max height difference (both positive and negative) away from origin.

parameters.name: innerSpacing
parameters.description: the distance between points in.

parameters.name: reachableBy_Ent
parameters.description: if defined, it will be used to make sure all the points are reachable by this entity from <origin> (not the entity's current position). Can pass in a float number radius to get points on NavMesh. Can also pass in string 'navvolume_small' or 'navvolume_big' to get points on navvolume. Note passing in entity radius only gives rough estimate, not correct result.

parameters.name: outerSpacing
parameters.description: if defined, the distance between points will be Lerped from <innerSpacing> to [outerSpacing], to create a gradual distribution.

parameters.name: distributionBias
parameters.description: (vec2) if defined, the density of the points will be changed gradually along the direction of this vector. the magnitude will be use as scalar, with 1 being the norm scale.

api.example: queryResult = PositionQuery_Source_Navigation( goalpos, self.radius, self.radius * 8, heightRadius, AI_GOAL_POINT_STEP, self, AI_GOAL_POINT_STEP * 0.2 )if ( queryResult.centerOnNav ){foreach( pointStruct in queryResult.data ){position = pointStruct.origindist = pointStruct.distToOrigin2D...}}

api.name: ScreenShake
api.description: Create a screen shake event on the given point.

parameters.name: sourcePoint
parameters.description: The position of the earthquake.

parameters.name: scalepitch
parameters.description: The scale of the shake in player's pitch. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: scaleyaw
parameters.description: The scale of the shake in player's yaw. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: scaleroll
parameters.description: The scale of the shake in player's roll. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration in seconds.

parameters.name: durationfadeup
parameters.description: Duration in seconds, included in base duration. Default is 0. Value of -1 means duration - durationfadeup.

parameters.name: durationfadedown
parameters.description: Duration in seconds, included in base duration. Default is -1. Value of -1 means duration - durationfadedown.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: The radius of shake, dampens as you move away from entity. Default is 0 = shake is global

parameters.name: frequencypitch
parameters.description: The scaled speed of the shake's pitch. Default is 1. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: frequencyyaw
parameters.description: The scaled speed of the shake's yaw. Default is 1. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: frequencyroll
parameters.description: The scaled speed of the shake's roll. Default is 1. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places.

parameters.name: exponent
parameters.description: The scale is multiplied by itself 'exponent' times to determine how the shake falls off. Default is 1 which is a linear falloff. Max is 100; Accurate to 2 decimal places

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Target is given if screen shake is to be shown to particular client only

api.example: ScreenShake( jolt.origin, 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 3, 0.2, 3, 850, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25 ); // locationalScreenShake( (0,0,0), 0.3, 0.3, 0.3, 3, 0.2, 3, 0, 0.5, 0.25, 0.25, player ); // non locational for one player only

api.name: serverfieldregister
api.description: Register a server field. Server fields are variable bit length fields communicated from client to server

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Unique name to identify the field.

parameters.name: num bits
parameters.description: How many bits to use for the field. Valid values are in the range of 1-32. Only ask for as many as you need.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the field. Currently supported types "int" or "float"

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Function that gets called when the value changes (each client can toggle this bit independently of the others)

api.example: RegisterServerField("my_field", 2, "int"); // registers an int field with 2 bits of resolution, that can hold the values 0,1,2,3.

api.name: SightConeTrace
api.description: Determines how much the entity can be seen from the given position, using the same check that is used by grenades. Performs multiple sight traces and returns an approximation to how much of the entity is visible from the given point (between 0 and 1). In SinglePlayer this will always be 1 if the entity is partially visible.

parameters.name: sight position
parameters.description: The point the sight starts at

parameters.name: ignore entity
parameters.description: An entity to ignore when doing the traces

parameters.name: cone forward
parameters.description: The forward direction of the cone, whose base is at the <sight position>.  Must be normalized.

parameters.name: cone angle
parameters.description: Angle in degrees from the line of sight to the edge of the cone.  Defaults to 65.

api.example: tankVisibilityFraction = tank SightConeTrace( player.origin, player, player.angles, 65)

api.name: SightTracePassed
api.description: Does a sight trace from start to end. Returns true if doesnt hit anything

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The bullet start point

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The bullet end point

parameters.name: hit characters
parameters.description: An entity to ignore

parameters.name: ignore entity
parameters.description: An entity to ignore

api.example: passed = SightTracePassed( player.origin + ( 0, 0, 64 ), self.origin + ( 0, 0, 64 ), false, undefined )

api.name: GrenadeThrow

parameters.description: An actor

api.description: returns true/false if actor is at cover node. (exposed node is considered as covernode)

api.description: returns true/false if actor is at cover node. (exposed node is not considered as covernode)

api.description: returns true/false if actor is at is flanked at cover node

api.name: IsGrenadePosSafe

parameters.description: (vector) position to throw at

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: (float) safety radius

api.name: IsInAnyBadPlace

parameters.description: which point to check.

parameters.description: center of radius to check.

parameters.description: (vector) the angles to interpolate to.

parameters.description: (point) start position.

parameters.description: (point) end position.

parameters.description: checks if the point would cause the AI to drop. Defaults to true.

parameters.description: checks if there are no obstructions between actor origin and <Position>.

api.name: MayMoveToPoint

parameters.name: check drop
parameters.description: checks if the point would cause the AI to drop. Defaults to true.

parameters.description: checks if there are no obstructions between actor origin and <Position>.

api.name: Melee

parameters.description: direction to attack, if not specified, uses direction to current enemy.

api.name: MeleeWithOffset
api.description: Makes this actor melee attack. Returns the entity hit, if any.

parameters.description: A vector offset added to the actor's eye position from which to start the melee trace.

api.description: Determine whether this actor is near its claim node and nearly matches the angle.

parameters.name: orient mode

parameters.description: (float) The yaw angle to face if orient mode is 'face angle'

parameters.name: direction vector
parameters.description: (vector) The direction vector to face if orient mode is 'face direction'

parameters.description: (vector) The point to face if orient mode is 'face point'

api.name: PathMode

parameters.name: path mode
parameters.description: (const string) PathMode must be 'dont move', 'move allowed', or 'move delayed'

parameters.description: (integer) 1 to clear path

parameters.description: (float) Amount of time (seconds) to wait if path mode is 'move delayed'

api.description: Pick up a grenade

api.description: Predicts the arrival direction vector using havok corner predictor.

api.description: Predicts the exit direction vector using havok corner predictor.

api.description: Predicts the path to look for upcoming corner using havok corner predictor.

api.name: ChangeFontScaleOverTime
api.description: Set a hud element to transition in fontScale over time.  Normally setting the fontScale of an element causes an immediate visual change. However, if the fontScale gets set within <time> after calling ChangeFontScaleOverTime, then the hud element will transition to the new fontScale over the remaining <time>.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time to scale the element font in seconds

api.example: level.introstring1 ChangeFontScaleOverTime( 1.2 );  level.introstring1.fontScale = 0.3;  // This will transition the fontScale from whatever it was before to the new value of 0.3 over 1.2 seconds.

api.name: Destroy
api.description: Remove this Hud element altogether.

api.name: FadeOverTime
api.description: Set a hud element to transition in color (or alpha) over time.  Normally setting the color (or alpha) of an element causes an immediate visual change. However, if the color (or alpha) gets set within <time> after calling fadeOverTime, then the hud element will transition to the new color over the remaining <time>.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: The time to fade the element in seconds

api.example: level.introstring1 FadeOverTime( 1.2 );  level.introstring1.alpha = 0.3;  // This will transition the alpha from whatever it was before to the new value of 0.3 over 1.2 seconds.

api.description: Does damage to an vehicle - usually as part of the damage callback

parameters.description: The entity that causes the damage.(e.g. a turret)

parameters.name: Attacker
parameters.description: The entity that is attacking.

parameters.name: Damage
parameters.description: Integer specifying the amount of damage done

parameters.name: Inner Damage
parameters.description: Integer specifying the amount of inner damage done

parameters.name: Outer Damage
parameters.description: Integer specifying the amount of outer damage done

parameters.name: Damage Flags
parameters.description: Integer specifying flags that are to be applied to the damage

parameters.name: Means Of Death
parameters.description: Integer specifying the method of death

parameters.name: Weapon
parameters.description: The weapon number of the weapon used to inflict the damage

parameters.name: Point
parameters.description: (vector) The Point of the damage

parameters.name: Radius
parameters.description: (float) The radius of the damage

parameters.name: ConeRadius
parameters.description: (float) The radius of the cone damage

parameters.name: ConeDirection
parameters.description: (vector) The direction of the cone damage

parameters.name: Offset Time
parameters.description: The time offset for the damage

api.example: self FinishVehicleRadiusDamage( eInflictor, eAttacker, iDamage, iDFlags, sMeansOfDeath, sWeapon, vPoint, fRadius, fConeRadius, fConeDir, psOffsetTime )

api.name: FireWeapon
api.description: Fire the vehicle's weapon

parameters.name: turret_index
parameters.description: turret index, 0 being main turret, 1~4 being gunners

parameters.name: target ent
parameters.description: A target entity for guided missiles

parameters.name: target offset
parameters.description: Only used for projectile and bomb weapons

parameters.name: attacker
parameters.description: real attacker who should take credit of this shot

api.name: Flip180
api.description: Flips this vehicle 180 (for going forwards / backwards along a path)

api.name: FreeVehicle
api.description: Frees this vehicle instance.  It will unlink any players occupying the vehicle. It will change the vehicle into a vehicle corpse.  It will send a death notify on the vehicle.  Once called the vehicle cannot move anymore.

api.name: GetAttachPos
api.description: Returns the origin and angles if the vehicle were to be attached to the path.  The origin and angles are returned as a vector array of size 2.  Origin is 1st and angles is 2nd.

parameters.name: node index
parameters.description: A node on the path to attach.

api.example: pos = self GetAttachPos( node )origin = pos[0]angles = pos[1]
